column6: The place of office of the Society
column7: The whole of the objects for which the Society is established
column8: The purposes for which the funds of the Society shall be applicable
column9: The terms of admission of members
column10: The conditions under which any member may become entitled to any benefit assured thereby
column11: The fines and foreitures to be imposed on any member
column12: The mode of holding meetings and fight of voting
column13: The manner of making, altering or rescinding rules
column14: The appointment and removal of a commitee of management of a Treasurer and other officers and of Trustees
column15: In the case of a Society with branches, the composition of controll body, and the conditions under which a branch may code from the society
column18: The audit of accounts once a year at least
column19: Annual returns to the registarar of the receipts, funds, effects and expenditure
column20: The number of members of the Society
column21: The inspection of the books of the Society by every person having an interest in the funds of the Society.
column22: The manner in which disputes between the society and any of its members, or any person claiming through a member of under the rules shall be settled.
